intro: Amyema duurenii, commonly known as the Duuren's lichen, is a unique species of lichen that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its crustose growth form, forming a thin, tightly adherent layer on rock surfaces, typically in arid or semi-arid environments. The thallus is usually pale yellow to orange in color, with a granular texture that distinguishes it from other lichen species. It is often found in regions with low humidity and high sunlight exposure, thriving in rocky habitats across southern Africa. Due to its specific ecological requirements, Amyema duurenii is considered a rare and specialized lichen with limited distribution.
